div.head: LETTRE N° 1.249

opener.title:
BOULEVARD SAINT-GERMAIN.-
PROJET d'ACCORD AVEC L'AMERICAN UNIVERSITY UNION.

div.p:
Krans m'avant exprimé le désir de connaître les condi-
tions qu'il me semble équitable de leur accorder pour qu'ils
occupent notre 2ème étage et puissent faire usage occasionnel et
limité, de la salle de conférences, de la terrasse et de la cave,
ainsi que de deux ou trois petites pièces supplémentaires, j'ai
reconnu que sa demande était sage et je lui ai dicté, rue Molitor,
le projet ci-joint de bail qu'il me renvoie après l'avoir traduit
en Anglais. Je ne me suis engagé qu'en principe sur l'ensemble,
mais non sur les détails. Voyez ce que vous en pensez, avec M.

M. Stokes et Norris. Il ne faut pas nous laisser surprendre par
le temps.

div.head: ANNEXE à ma LETTRE N° 1.249
div.p:
(COPY)
January 25th 1923
Baron d'Estournelles de Constant, 34ter rue Molitor,
Auteuil.

Dear Monsieur d'Estournelles de Constant: To avoid all possibility of error, will you permit us
to state in a brief résumé our understanding regarding the rooms,
etc., in the hôtel at 173 Boulevard Saint-Germain, which the
Dotation Carnegie has kindly offered to rent to the American Uni-
versity Union.

Dr. Van Dyke, absent on a lecture tour to the Provincial
Universities, leaves me to present the views of the Union in Paris
on the question of the accomodations put at our disposal.

Our understanding is as follows:
1 - Deuxième étage (two flights up - called in America "third
floor"). The Union shall have the exclusive use of the entire
deuxième étage (third floor). It is understood that the Union
shall use only the staircase that gives on the court. It shall
not have the use of the principal staircase, nor of the elevator
(except in particular cases to be specified later.)
2 - Lecture-Room (Salle de Conférences). The Union shall
have at need, the use of the lecture-room on the ground floor
(rez-de-chaussée), but only after securing permissionnfrom the Dotation which shall always have the first claim upon it.

- 2 - 3 - The terrace on the roof. The Dotation Carnegie, while
reserving to itself the entire control of the terrace, will give
the Union the use of it as generously and frequently as possible.

4 - Cellar: Shower-baths, gymnasium, lavabos, water-closets,
etc. The Union, after a preliminary agreement with the Dotation
Carnegie, shall be authorized to install, if it so desires, in
the spacious cellar, shower-baths, a small gymnasium or fencing-
room, a kitchen, water-closets and lavabos.

5 - Small studies for Professors (cabinets de Travail)
The Dotation Carnegie will, if possible, assign sufficient space
on the quatrième étage (four flights up - called "fifth floor" in
America) to provide for two of three studies (cabinets de travail)
which can be put by the Union at the disposal of American profes-
sors temporarily in Paris.

6-The Union will conform to such rules - especialy rules
concerning the entrance and departure of students at night, the
hours of evening enternainments, and the use of the cellar -- as the Dotation and the Union, by common accord, shall frame.

I cannot close without thanking you very cordially on
behalf of the Union, especially for favoring our organisation by
making choice of it as your first tenant, and in general for
your helpdul kindness on which the Union and its directors have
always counted and on which they know they can/always count.

Believe me,
Sincerely and respectfully yours,
(Sgd:) Horation KRANS Assistant Director.
